Element.Dimensions.Extras.desc: Contains methods to work without where scroll is or if it's at the bottom of Elements and the window object.

Element.Reflect.desc: Contains methods to work with reflections

HistoryManager.desc: Observes back/forward button usage and saves states for registered modules into the hash. This allows to bookmark specific states for an application.

pngfix.desc: Fixes transparent png files and dom elements with transparent png backgrounds for IE6

Fx.ScrollExtras.desc: Effect to smoothly scroll any element, including the window.

Fx.MorphElement.desc: Creates a morph effect on any element.

Fx.GridScroll.desc: Creates a morph effect on any element.

Fx.SmoothAnchors.desc: Creates a morph effect on any element.

MooEditable.desc: Class for creating a WYSIWYG editor, for contentEditable-capable browsers.

MooEditable.UI.MenuList.desc: UI Class to create a menu list (select) element.

MooEditable.UI.ButtonOverlay.desc: UI Class to create a button element with a popup overlay.

MooEditable.Extras.desc: Extends MooEditable to include more (simple) toolbar buttons.

MooEditable.Group.desc: A MooEditable extension for having multiple MooEditable instances on a page controlled by one toolbar.

SliderEx.desc: Class for creating horizontal and vertical slider controls.

BySlideMenu.desc: BySlideMenu allows you to easily create a beautiful accordion menu (sliding menu) on any element you want (ul/li, div, p ...) using images and/or text.

ByZoomer.desc: ByZoomer allows you to easily create a picture gallery which will be nicely zoomed when clicked.

AjaxLinks.desc: makes links on a page load content via Request method.

ElementSwapper.desc: Fades a collection of elements without tabs

Tabs.desc: Handles the scripting for a common UI layout; the tabbed box.

MorphTabs.desc: Handles the scripting for a common UI layout; the tabbed box.

Pagination.desc: A little script that can turn your ugly looking numbers into a nice looking Slider.

mooForms.desc: turns the radio and checkboxes into custom images.

Canvas.desc: Adds canvas element with the getContext, if browser is IE

Path.desc: Functionality for Paths as described by WHATWG

Rects.desc: Uses Paths to create rectangular shapes

Image.desc: Adds the functionality of placing images in the canvas element

State.desc: Need to save states? You get the idea.
